definition: lit. to pull chestnuts out of the fire (idiom)/fig. to be sb's cat's-paw
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
chestnut
surname Li

sentences.english: They like to jump and with their two front paws they will wave at you.
sentences.chinese: 他們喜歡跳，帶着兩個戰線火中取栗，他們將在波你。

sentences.english: They are not going to let themselves be used to pull anybody's chestnuts out of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他們不會允許自己被利用來爲別人火中取栗。

sentences.english: Neither was eager to pull our chestnuts out of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆都不想替我們火中取栗。
